author: brane
msg: Fix link order of APR libs to get rid of a ton of link warnings.
No, don't ask me why this works ...
* clients/cmdline/subversion_client.dsp, svnadmin/svnadmin.dsp,
svnlook/svnlook.dsp: Link apriconv.lib before aprutil.lib.

author: sussman
msg: Bugfix for the bug discovered by Marcus: 'svn diff -rX:Y file' was
failing over ra_dav.  It turns out that svn_path_remove_component_nts
was broken; it was converting "/iota" to "", instead of "/".  (This
bug was biting us in mod_dav_svn/update.c:640, causing corrupted
vsn-rsc-urls to be sent back to the client.)
Patch by sussman and kfogel.
* path.c (svn_path_remove_component_nts, svn_path_remove_component):
preserve leading '/' if we chop back to it.
* svn_string.c, svn_string.h (svn_stringbuf_chop_back_to_char): remove
this now-unused function.
* stringtest.c (test10):  remove.
(test11, test12, test13):  renumber to N-1.
* svn_path.h (svn_path_split):  clarify docstring with examples.
* path-test.c (test_path_split):  change test to expect proper split
behavior;  add some more test cases to match the examples.

author: kfogel
msg: * tools/hook-scripts/commit-email.pl: Set Content-Type and
Content-Transfer-Encoding, since at least part of a commit email is
in UTF-8.

author: kfogel
msg: Patch by: Marcus Comstedt <marcus@mc.pp.se>
> From: Marcus Comstedt <marcus@mc.pp.se>
> Subject: [PATCH] mod_dav_svn directory listing i18n fix, and odd bug
> To: dev@subversion.tigris.org
> Ok, my DAV i18n testing has begun, and so far mostly so good.  The
> directory listing generated when browsing the repository with a web
> browser fails to set a charset, though.  Since the default charset for
> HTML is ISO-8859-1, filenames do not get displayed correctly.  This
> patch fixes the problem: [...]
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(dav_svn_set_headers): Set charset to UTF-8 in HTML case.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_files.c
(check_adm_exists): Fix speeling error in error messij.
